data: Claudiu Stan Associate Professor Location Smith Hall 369 Email claudiu.stan@rutgers.edu Operational Unit Faculty Department Physics Share Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit Whatsapp Email Print Biography Claudiu Stan received his Ph.D. in Physics from Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Prior to joining Rutgers as faculty, he was a postdoctoral fellow in the Chemistry and Chemical Biology department at Harvard University, and a scientist at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory. He conducted research in several different areas, including ultracold gases and Bose-Einstein condensation, microfluidics, self-assembly, fluid dynamics, laser ablation, and applications of X-ray lasers in physics and biology. His research at Rutgers includes the study of phase transitions and ultrafast dynamics in liquids and soft matter, metastable liquid water (supercooled water, and water at negative pressures), developing new applications for X-ray lasers, and delivering liquid samples for extreme-intensity lasers. Research Initiatives Investigating and triggering phase transitions in metastable water with X-ray free-electron lasers. Investigation of rapid and nonlinear fluid dynamics phenomena associated with the rapid serial diffraction measurements at MHz X-ray lasers. Liquid sample delivery for experiments at petawatt laser facilities. Education Postdoctoral Fellow, Harvard University. Advisor: George M. Whitesides Ph.D., Physics, MIT, (2005) Advisor: Wolfgang Ketterle B.Sc., Technological Physics, University of Bucharest (1999) Courses Taught Introduction To Modern Physics (21:750:316) General Physics I (21:750:203) General Physics II (21:750:204) Physics Seminar (21:750:491) Special Topics in Experimental Physics (26:755:610) Doctoral Seminar (26:755:791) Expertise Ultrafast molecular and nanoscale dynamics, X-ray lasers, microfluidics, phase transitions, metastable liquids, biophysics.
